intro: Philotheca longifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved philotheca, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is known for its aromatic foliage. Philotheca longifolia is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ecological benefits to native wildlife.
